bug.author: gmuraru
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
Test the reciprocal method from precision using negative numbers <denchmark-h:h2>Expected Behavior</denchmark-h>
All tests are passing <denchmark-h:h2>Screenshots</denchmark-h>
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. <denchmark-h:h2>Additional Context</denchmark-h>
It might require changes to the reciprocal method

comments.comment: I guess the Log and NR method are a problem. Division works fine.. Will look into the issue

I guess the Log and NR method are a problem. Division works fine.. Will look into the issue
Also, there might be worth checking out how <denchmark-link:https://github.com/facebookresearch/CrypTen>CrypTen</denchmark-link> is doing - if they take into consideration negative values. If not, one idea (it might not be the greatest) is to use symmetry.
hey could you review my PR? <denchmark-link:https://github.com/OpenMined/PySyft/pull/4065>#4065</denchmark-link>
